Title: Nigeria: How politicians started dashing cars and houses to judges
Summary: Ibrahim Babangida was supposedly in the last year of an interminable transition at the end of which he promised to hand over power to an elected civilian administration . Moshood Abiola was actively canvassing to inherit that mantle .

Title: Women’s U-20 World Cup Qualifiers: Falconets to depart for Kigali on Thursday
Summary: Two-time World Cup silver medallists Nigeria will kick off their race to next year's FIFA U-20 Women’s World Cup finals when they take on their Rwandan counterparts on Sunday, in a second round, first leg encounter in Kigali .

Title: Flying Eagles head for 12-day camping in Santiago
Summary: Nigeria’s U-20 boys’ team, the Flying Eagles, have departed for Chile to begin a 12-day final phase camping in the South American nation . The Flying Eagles are preparing for their participation in this year's FIFA World Cup finals .

Title: My best yet to come, Iheanacho tells ecstatic Celtic fans
Summary: Kelechi Iheanacho is ready to make up for lost time at Celtic . Seven months on from a failed loan deal, he has finally got his move to Parkhead . The former Manchester United star says his best is yet to come .

Title: Amusan’s ‘solitary’ silver medal saves Nigeria’s blushes
Summary: World Record holder in 100m hurdles, Tobi Amusan, won a silver medal at the 20th World Athletics Championships . After two fruitless attempts in 1991 and 2007, Nigeria celebrated her first medal on Japanese soil yesterday .

Title: Cartoon: Common man boxed in
Summary:

Title: JTB: Nigerians without Tax ID can operate bank accounts
Summary: The Joint Tax Board said Nigerians without Tax ID can continue to operate bank accounts . The four new Tax Acts signed by President Bola Tinubu will come into effect from January 1, 2026 .

Title: Our plant ended 50 years of fuel queues in Nigeria – Dangote Refinery
Summary: Aliko Dangote declared that since the refinery began producing petrol a year ago, Nigeria’s five-decade-long struggle with fuel queues has finally come to an end . … we’re creating jobs, not displacing anyone, he said . Title: Post-harvest losses: Storage facilities essential, ‘ll address wastage — Agric Minister
Summary: Sen Abubakar Kyari reaffirmed the Federal Government's resolve to revitalise the nation’s silos concession programme . …as post-harvest losses stand at $10bn annually .

Title: Access Bank, Akwa Ibom State partner to fight cervical cancer
Summary: Access Bank, Akwa Ibom State partner to fight cervical cancer . Project UWUS (Unstoppable Woman, Unbreakable Spirit) is a cervical cancer awareness and screening campaign . Cervical cancer is the second most common cancer among women in the country .
